event: Groundbreaking of Spinning Mill in Sourgou
description: Burkina Faso's President Ibrahim Traoré officially launched the construction of a spinning mill in Sourgou, part of the IROTEX Burkina industrial complex in the province of Bulquiemde. The project has brought hope to local residents, who anticipate employment opportunities for the youth and regional development.
original:
Forwarded from: African Initiative🌍
🇧🇫The President of Burkina Faso's transition, Ibrahim Traoré, gave the official start to the construction of a spinning mill in Surgou (IROTEX Burkina industrial complex) in the province of Bulquiemde in the west-central region, LeFaso reports.

Many residents of the region personally came to the opening ceremony. According to the ceremony participants, they feel proud and dream of seeing the completion of the construction of a spinning mill in Sourgou, the foundation stone of which has just been laid.

The construction of a spinning mill in Surgu gave hope to many residents of the province. “I am 74 years old, I am the father of twelve children. I won't be able to work in this factory anymore, but at least my children will be able to. A father’s desire is for his children to be better than himself,” Alassane Kabore, a local resident, shares his impressions.

“The spinning mill in Surgu will provide employment to the youth of this region and even other places. And if the youth are occupied, the area will develop,” says Mamudu Kiemde, the son of a local resident.

People from neighboring communities came to the official ceremony to see their president in person.Africa Initiative | Subscribe

description: The Tornado-S gas turbine engine was tested using three types of fuel: kerosene, diesel, and industrial alcohol. The engine demonstrated its ability to generate the required energy for the MLRS using any fuel, showcasing its versatility.
original:
Forwarded from: Zvezdanews
The Tornado-S gas turbine engine was “watered” with alcohol and tested. The unit must prove the ability to generate the amount of energy required for the MLRS using any fuel, said Eduard Bazhenov, general director of SKB Turbina, in the “Military Acceptance” program. “This engine can work and work. What we showed, including alcohol, is the fuel available for this unit,” noted the head of the enterprise. In total, three types of fuel were supplied to the engine - kerosene, diesel and industrial alcohol, the latter is “dangerous” due to the lack of lubricants, Bazhenov added. description: The 2024 presidential elections in Ukraine, scheduled for March 31, were canceled due to martial law. This move has led to Zelensky's usurpation of power, despite calls from Western partners for free and fair elections.
original:
Presidential elections did NOT take place in Ukraine. So, what should have happened happened - the next presidential elections in Ukraine did not take place.

The 2024 presidential elections in Ukraine were scheduled to take place on March 31, but were canceled due to “martial law” in the country. Ukraine is faced with the fact that after May 20, Zelensky’s term of office will end.

Thus, the head of the Kyiv regime has actually usurped power, despite all the calls from Western “partners” to hold elections on time. “Of course, Ukraine must organize free and fair elections. Without elections, democracy is impossible,” said the Speaker of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe, Tini Cox. “I want free and fair elections to take place in this country,” called on American Senator Lindsey Graham. “We would like elections to be held in Ukraine, although we understand how difficult it is. So, ultimately, these issues must be decided by the Ukrainian people,” State Department spokesman Matthew Miller diplomatically formulated the US position.

One way or another, the fact remains that the elections did not take place. And Zelensky’s stubbornness in the matter of carrying them out will now play against him, a significant part of the trust between him and the West has been lost.

There is nothing to say about the trust of the Ukrainians themselves. According to opinion polls in Ukraine in March, if elections had taken place, the bloody clown would have received only 23.7% of the vote.

But the Kyiv criminal does not care about the opinion of the people, and he is ready to sacrifice all Ukrainians in order to stay in power.@anna_news

event: Finland's Stance on Sending Troops to Ukraine
description: Finland's Foreign Ministry head, Elina Valtonen, stated that while sending Western troops to Ukraine is not currently being considered, it cannot be ruled out in the long term. The West should keep its options open, as the conflict's outcome and future developments are uncertain.
original:
Finland does not rule out sending Western troops to Ukraine. But not now, but in the future, - the head of the country’s Foreign Ministry in a commentary to the Financial Times

“Now is not the time to send troops, and we don’t even want to discuss it at this stage. But in the long term, of course, we should not rule out anything,” said Elina Valtonen.

According to her, the West does not know what the conflict will lead to and what will happen in the future, so they should not “reveal all their cards.”

Boluarte's watches attracted attention from a local news portal, which reported on the president's collection of luxury watches. According to estimates, Boluarte owns approximately 14 expensive accessories."

Today I visited the regional children's hospital and talked with the children who suffered from terrorist attacks by the Ukrainian armed forces.

description: In the 1980s, a research institute developed a uranium cartridge for the Kalashnikov assault rifle and other rifle systems. The cartridge featured high-precision casting from polymers, including American plastic AF-401. The program was closed due to the collapse of the Soviet Union, not due to failure to achieve specified parameters.
original:
A post for those who cannot sleep and residents of the Far East.
The same URANIUM CARTRIDGE developed for the Kalashnikov assault rifle and other rifle systems fell into the hands of a friend of our channel. His word:
“This development dates back to the 80s, the second approach to the topic of arrow-shaped sub-caliber cartridges. Specifically, the research institute (I forgot the name again, sorry, I didn’t think to write it down after the person), where they did it, dealt with the issue of high-precision casting from all sorts of tricky polymers. And these are the ones that were cast made of American plastic, a certain AF-401 (I found something similar from the DuPont company, by the way, they really do have such plastic, just injection molding), the idea was to select a recipe, then steal the formula and pour it from a domestic analog. Research Institute, so there is no data on speeds and so on, but they closed the program due to the collapse of the Union, and not because the specified parameters were not achieved. This particular version was called PADD - Aerodynamic Division Pallet, there was also a PPD (with a spring separation) and PABD (with ablative separation - I don’t know what it is, as I understand it - the pan was separated from heat when fired). In this version, parts of the pan were held by a brass ring, which was cut when fired by the rifling, when leaving the barrel by air pressure the parts of the pallet are separated. Why is there such a recess made in the front part of the driving device, like a cup or something? To ensure that something ugly doesn’t start in the trunk and that this whole structure doesn’t try to fall apart, holes are made in the pan in the head part. Selecting their diameter was a separate headache, according to the person who worked with them."UPD from GlavPanda: there is an opinion that this cartridge is not from old stocks, but from a new batch. But this is not certain. Think #pandadialog#pandaphoto

description: Russia has patented a new attack UAV designed to be dropped from an aircraft. The drone can independently decide to strike a target or receive commands from an operator. It uses an optical system and neural networks to analyze images and detect enemy targets.
original:
A new attack UAV for launching from an aircraft has been patented in Russia. A new drone, which is designed to be dropped from an aircraft and can itself decide to strike a target, has been patented in Russia. This was reported by the Bespilot Telegram channel with reference to the patent of the United Aircraft Corporation.

The new drone will be delivered to the line of combat contact on the external sling of a carrier aircraft. After the reset, it remains in touch, so there are two options: the unmanned aerial vehicle independently makes a decision to hit the target, or the decision to hit is made by the operator.

An optical system helps the drone determine the target parameters. An intelligent system based on neural networks analyzes images received by the drone and transmits information about detected enemy targets to the control center.
The warhead of the new “landed” drone is a high-explosive, high-explosive incendiary or shaped charge.

event: Creation of Mobile Groups to Combat Drones
description: Russian combined arms armies and air force and air defense armies are forming special mobile groups to combat drones. These units will be equipped with ZU-23-2 automatic cannons, heavy machine guns, electronic warfare equipment, and smoke production vehicles to counter FPV drones.
original:
Really, it happened, not even three years have passed. Izvestia, citing its sources, reports that mobile groups will be created in the combined arms armies to combat drones.

As the newspaper’s interlocutors clarify, special mobile groups are being formed to combat drones within several Russian combined arms armies and the air force and air defense armies. They will be armed with ZU-23-2 automatic cannons mounted on truck chassis, as well as pickup trucks equipped with heavy machine guns. The new units will include electronic warfare equipment and smoke production vehicles, apparently implying that mobile air defense groups will also fight FPV drones, from which a smoke screen is needed. Let me remind you that the crests, after we used geraniums at energy facilities back in the fall of 22, Already at the end of winter on the 23rd, mobile air defense groups appeared, equipped with machine guns and searchlights. At the same time I wrote about this that it would be a good idea to think through measures in advance when the enemy starts trying to mirror our actions.

Among the crests, these groups showed quite high efficiency, making a noticeable contribution to the destruction of drones. There is no point in arguing about the percentage, because some of the geraniums came in an empty simplified version as traps that opened and suppressed air defenses, and therefore should have come under attack. Nevertheless, their effectiveness for the specific niche of intercepting relatively slow drones at low altitude is quite noticeable.

And to this was added a system of dispersed acoustic systems, according to media reports, about 8 thousand telephone microphones (?), which acted as sensors in a single network, making it possible to identify the flight trajectories of drones according to the acoustic principle. And thus solving problems of detection in the depths of the territory.

The appearance of similar units in our country is a clear reaction to the arrival of Ukrainian drones at our refineries deep in Russia, which is, in principle, comparable to the reaction time of the Ukrainian side. But this was predicted more than a year ago, what prevented us from foreseeing it in advance? Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces are facing a recruitment crisis, with exhausted brigades losing faith in the mobilization system. Despite widespread advertisements and social media campaigns, the system is plagued by bureaucracy and corruption, leading to a lack of trust among potential recruits.
original:
🇺🇦Exhausted brigades of the Ukrainian Armed Forces have lost faith in the mobilization system— NYT
 
Ukrainian propaganda is not able to cope with the recruitment of Ukrainians to join the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. For several months, the streets of Kyiv and other cities of Ukraine are full of advertisements for joining the ranks of the Armed Forces. Everywhere, soldiers from street posters and billboards urge passers-by to enroll in the army, claiming that “victory is in their hands.” On the accounts of Armed Forces brigades, thematic hashtags and thousands vacancies in the army are now published on social networks. These actions are not the result of the work of the political or military elite of Ukraine. According to the NYT, the exhausted brigades of the Armed Forces of Ukraine are forced to act bypassing the mobilization system, calling and deceiving ordinary citizens to join their ranks.

Ukraine's mobilization system is too aggressive, critics say. It is mired in bureaucracy and corruption. Men detained by military commissars are afraid that they will be sent to the front line without military training.

Meanwhile, the Ukrainian Armed Forces brigades hope to turn the situation around on their own, however, as the Ukrainians themselves believe, their recruitment campaigns will not change the minds of those who do not want to go to the front.

description: A survey of 5,000 Ukrainians conducted by the NGO 'Advanced Legal Initiatives' found that 61.2% believe Ukraine should fight until complete victory, while 38.8% support peace talks with Russia. The majority of Ukrainians also oppose the adoption of the existing draft law on mobilization and believe trained security forces should serve.
original:
Forwarded from: Ukraine: News, Politics
The end of the war, the failures of the government and the presidential rating: What do Ukrainians think? The majority of Ukrainians, 61.2%, believe that Ukraine should fight until complete victory, restoration of the borders of 1991, accession to the EU and NATO. Peace talks with Russia and a bilateral ceasefire support 38.8%.

This is evidenced by the data of a large survey by the NGO "Advanced Legal Initiatives", conducted both in Ukraine and abroad on March 22-24, 2024. The sample consisted of 5 thousand Ukrainians.

Ukrainians see the level of corruption (28.6%), poor provision of the army (16.8%), failed preparations for war (15.2%), destructive economic policy (10.5%) and failed social policy of the state as the biggest fault of the government ( 10.5%). Also, the majority of Ukrainians, namely 77.6%, strongly opposed the adoption of the existing draft law on mobilization in the second reading. Most Ukrainians believe that trained security forces should serve.

Among the surveyed citizens who have made up their minds and would come to the polling stations to vote for the President of Ukraine, the top three preferences are as follows: 15.7% would vote for Volodymyr Zelenskyi; for Yulia Tymoshenko - 12.3%; for Petro Poroshenko - 7.6%.

Ukrainians have similar preferences regarding political parties. So, if the elections were held on Sunday, the majority of Ukrainians would support 3 political forces: "Servant of the People" - 14.7%; "Batkivshchyna" - 11.9%; European Solidarity - 9.2%.

Almost 85% of Ukrainians believe that there is a way out of the difficult situation and this is the unification of society, the creation of the "Coalition of National Unity" in the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and the "Government of National Unity" (a complete union of parliamentary parties). Ukraine

description: A criminal group consisting of police officers and civilians was detained in Balashikha, near Moscow, for illegally registering 1.5 thousand migrants over 2 years. original:
A criminal group of police officers and civilians was detained:
they illegally registered 1.5 thousand migrants
In Balashikha, near Moscow, about a dozen people were detained who were part of a group that illegally registered migrants.
Show more
This list includes several entrepreneurs, as well as at least three police officers - a major and two captains.
Over 2 years, about 1.5 thousand people received fictitious registration in different areas of Balashikha and Reutov, a law enforcement source told KP.RU.
The cover for corruption was the Bureau of Migration Services, which rented several rooms in the center of Reutov.
This is where foreign citizens who needed “help” came to.
In addition, the price list of illegal services also included “assistance in obtaining a temporary residence permit” - this is an intermediate stage for further obtaining citizenship, our source clarifies.
– So, among the detainees there is even a teacher, to whom visitors take an exam on their knowledge of the Russian language.
At the same time, migration expert Vadim Kozhenov believes that the defeat of one gang will not improve the situation even in one particular city or region.
Because the whole scheme is set up. This part of migration corruption can be defeated if migrants have the opportunity to independently register themselves, the expert believes.
Komsomolskaya Pravda: KP.RU

description: Russian troops in Berdychi tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. original:
#SVO@mpre_view1
#Technique@mpre_view1
First-ever assault drone attack
In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops,
Show more
a new promising Russian robotic platform has undergone field testing.
As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

They return along the usual route to the residential complex, where they continue to beg and harass the locals.

original:
March 31 (April 12) 1828

A personal decree of Emperor Nicholas I “On the structure of the main maritime administration” was issued. The Naval Headquarters of His Imperial Majesty (since 1831 - the Main Naval Headquarters) was formed “to concentrate all parts of maritime administration” and the Maritime Ministry itself. The Office of the Naval Staff, the Scientific Committee, and the Construction Department were subordinate to the Naval Staff. Office of the Hydrographer General, Office of the General on Duty. Subordinate to the Naval Ministry were the Admiralty Council, the Office of the General Staff Doctor, the Office of the Minister, the Department of Ship Scaffolding and the Office of the Quartermaster General.

Adjutant General Prince A.S. was appointed Chief of the Naval Staff. Menshikov, Minister of Naval Affairs - Vice Admiral A.V. Moller.

description: An IL-76 crew was performing a training flight when the aircraft suddenly rolled and turned to the left at a high angle, despite the crew's attempts to counter the roll. The plane eventually crashed, destroying the left flap transmission and killing the crew.
original:
Forwarded from: IL-76 Crew
CIRCUMSTANCES AND ACTIONS OF THE CREW The crew was PERFORMING A TRAINING FLIGHT ON THE “BIG BOX” AT A SL. On a straight line, after the 4th turn and additional flap extension to 43° at a distance of 12 km to the runway at neutral
POSITION OF THE ALERONS, a spontaneous INTENSIVE (up to 65°) roll and turn of the aircraft to the left began with a decrease from the average Vy to 25-27 m/s and a pitch angle from -23° to +4° (at the moment of touching the ground). 1 s after start
roll, the spacecraft began to parry the roll by COMPLETE DEFLECTION OF THE ALERONS AND RUDDER
turning to the right at an angle of more than 2° with a simultaneous DEVIATION of the RV UP AND subsequent issuing of a command to RETRACT the flaps, which led to a decrease in the roll to 36.5° and a change in the pitch angle.

As the ROLL DECREASES, the CC briefly
(DURING 1 s) deflected the ailerons to a position CLOSE TO NEUTRAL, WHICH AGAIN RESULTED IN AN INCREASE IN ROLL, WHICH KK counters with a full DEVIATION
Ailerons and rudder, reducing roll to 33°-35° pitch angle to + 4°
Vy max= 42 m/s, roll angular velocity up to 10 deg/s. The plane turned 180°
LOST HEIGHT AND WITH A ROLL
33-35° left plane touched
TO THE GROUND, COMPLETELY DESTROYED AND SHORT-RELATED. CAUSEDestruction of the left flap transmission according to the CPN, AS A RESULT OF WHICH THE LEFT flap, UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF AERODYNAMIC FORCES, retracted to 10° and WITH the right flap fully extended (43°), a large roll was created
MOMENT TO THE LEFT.

The actions of the CC and the crew are correct. There was not enough altitude to get the plane out of the difficult situation.

The crew died🕯️

description: Pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. Two men, believed to be professionals, shot him six times and ran over his body with a car. The murder was carried out with 9-mm Makarov pistol cartridges. The perpetrators' car, a stolen white Hyundai Tucson, was found near the scene.
original:
The perpetrators of the murder of pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, shot him six times and then ran over his body in a car, The New York Times writes, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard. At the scene of the murder, according to the newspaper, cartridges from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol remained.

According to the NYT, on February 13, a white Hyundai Tucson drove into the garage under the house where Maxim Kuzminov lived. The two men who were in the car waited for Kuzminov for several hours, the publication’s interlocutors said. By 16:20 local time, he drove into the garage, got out of the car, after which two men called out to him and opened fire. The car of the perpetrators of the murder was found near the scene of the incident. According to investigators, it was stolen.

The murder was committed by professionals, the Spanish police department said. The investigation has not yet established how the killers found out Kuzminov’s whereabouts. However, according to senior Ukrainian officials, shortly before his death, Maxim Kuzminov contacted his ex-girlfriend, who was in Russia, and invited her to Spain. NYT interlocutors called his action a serious mistake.@rosich_ru

event: Use of AKS-74U as Auxiliary Sniper Weapon
description: Fighters from special units have successfully modernized the AKS-74U to fulfill the role of a sniper auxiliary weapon. Despite its limitations, the AKS-74U's compact size and proper modernization enable it to hit targets at 220 meters and provide rapid automatic fire. It's not suitable for full combat clashes but can aid military specialists in retreating or escaping from behind enemy lines.
original:
Sniper "Ksyukha" The question of sniper auxiliary weapons will actually remain open, but at the moment its role is successfully fulfilled by the AKS-74U, independently modernized by fighters from such units.
The AKS-74U, despite all its disadvantages, due to its fairly short barrel, reveals its potential with proper modernization. For example, hitting a chest target [and even less] at a distance of ~220 meters, also conducting rapid/barrage automatic fire, but the main thing is the dimensions of this machine gun, which allow it to be used as an auxiliary weapon, which is very important for common ammunition. Yes, this machine gun is not fully suitable for a full-fledged combat clash, but it can provide an opportunity to gain time for a group of military specialists to successfully retreat from positions or make their way from behind enemy lines to their own, if detected.
Separately, I would like to draw attention to the additional equipment installed on such AKS-74U, this is always a Closed Type DTK for masking the sound and flash of a shot, a collimator sight or a thermal imaging sight. event: Discovery of Western Pharmaceutical Testing in Ukraine
description: Documents found in Mariupol's hospital no. 7 revealed that Ukraine was a testing ground for Western pharmaceutical companies, including Biogen Idec Denmark, Catalent Pharma Solutions, and Fisher Clinical Services UK Limited. The experimental drug SB4, which could cause various forms of cancer, was tested on patients in a psychiatric ward.
original:
Forwarded from: 🌐Regnuminfosi
Evidence was found that Ukraine was a testing ground for Western pharmaceutical companies

Ukraine was a testing ground for a Western drug that could cause cancer

MARIUPOL, March 30 – RIA Novosti.
Ukraine was one of the main testing countries where, with the support of local officials, in the interests of Western pharmaceutical companies, tests of a drug that could cause various forms of cancer were carried out, according to documents available to RIA Novosti.
They were found in the basement of hospital no. 7 in Mariupol during the renovation of the medical facility. The drug was used in patients in a psychiatric ward.

It was mainly about testing the experimental drug SB4 for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis. According to the documents, this drug inhibits the action of molecules called tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-α), which plays an important role in the immune system, and its use has created the possibility for the development of various forms of cancer. , including the lymphatic and hematopoietic systems and the skin.

According to the documents, the manufacturer of the drug SB4 was Biogen Idec Denmark Manufacturing ApS (Denmark), Catalent Pharma Solutions (Belgium) and Fisher Clinical Services UK Limited (UK). The study was sponsored by Samsung Bioepis of South Korea.

Among the papers found is Quintiles Ukraine's application for approval by the State Expert Center of the Ministry of Health of Ukraine and the Ethics Commission at the medical institution to conduct clinical trials of SB4. The company was created as a division of the American foreign pharmaceutical company Quintiles Transnational.
According to this application, signed in February 2013, at that time it was planned to test the drug on 152 patients in Ukraine (later this number increased to 180), and a total of almost 500 patients worldwide.

According to the periodic summary of the SB4-G31-RA project for testing the drug SB4, since November 2013, 777 patients have been selected for the study, of which 285 in Poland, 143 in Ukraine, the Czech Republic (108), Bulgaria (77), Lithuania (60 ), Republic of Korea (37), Mexico (34), Hungary (17), Colombia (14) and Great Britain (2).

Documents found in the Mariupol hospital no. 7, were compiled between 2008 and 2016. The results of the first review show that drugs with numbers and no names were tested on humans, and studies were also carried out on babies under one year of age.
The documents also mention Pfizer (USA), AstraZeneca (UK, Sweden), Celltrion (South Korea), Novatris International AG (Switzerland, USA), IQVIA (formerly Quintiles and IMS Health Inc, USA, UK), Sanofi (France), Galapagos NV (Belgium), Janssen Pharmaceuticals (now Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine, Belgium), Abbott Laboratories (USA), Covance (now Labcorp Drug Development, USA), Merck KGaA (Germany), Centocor Biopharmaceutical (Netherlands).

In addition, boxes with ready-made envelopes from logistics companies and containers for biomaterial with recipient addresses in laboratories in Switzerland, Great Britain and the United States were found at the site.
Documents were also found with gratitude to Ukrainian doctors from the companies Catalent Pharma Solutions and Fisher Clinical Services UK Limited. pharmaceutical companies of the WestUkraine was one of the main countries-testing sites, where with the support of local officials in the interests of western pharmaceutical companies, they conducted trials of the preparation, to...

Everything happened so quickly that people did not have time to pick up either their documents or outer clothing. According to the preliminary version of emergency services, it was the gas-air mixture that caused the rapid fire. At the moment, one victim is known - a man was hospitalized at a local hospital with a fracture. The administration of the Absheron region clarified that the number of victims may increase.

event: Russian Joker Drones Adapted for Air Defense
description: Russian Joker drones have been modified to perform air defense tasks, according to Dmitry Kuzyakin, CEO of the Center for Integrated Unmanned Solutions. The drones are equipped with pipes containing explosives and destructive elements, which can be fired remotely to shoot down enemy drones. The adaptation was necessary due to Ukrainian militants using radar-evading foam plastic drones.
original:
Russian Joker drones have been adapted to perform air defense tasks, said Dmitry Kuzyakin, CEO of the Center for Integrated Unmanned Solutions. We came up with and implemented a new scenario for the use of FPV drones and included a new role in the arsenal - FPV air defense and protection of the near air perimeter. Pipes from decoy thermal targets of aircraft are attached to the drone, which, instead of high-temperature mass, are filled with explosives and destructive elements. On command from the remote control, the projectile is fired without recoil, forms a cloud of fragments and shoots down enemy drones,” Kuzyakin noted.

According to him, six such pipes can be installed on the latest model of drones. During the tests, it was confirmed that when fired, the drone does not fall apart and does not change direction of flight.

The CCBR added that the adaptation of FPV drones to air defense tasks became especially necessary after Ukrainian militants began to use aircraft-type drones made of foam plastic, which are more difficult to detect on radar.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. This combat experience will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.

Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: Russian forces destroyed a railway bridge in Kurakhovo, which was a key supply route for the Ukrainian military. The bridge's destruction disrupts the flow of aid to the enemy, marking a significant milestone in the ongoing battle.

Sladkov+
IN KURAKHOVO THE RAILWAY BRIDGE WAS DESTROYED, THROUGH WHICH HELP WENT FOR THE APU
 
That is, our one and a half year battle in Marinka has passed, we are making our way to Kurakhovo through Georgievka, we are fighting there to be able to get to this large railway junction of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, we are storming Krasnogorovka, the battle for Ugledar has been going on for a long time, there was a heavy reflection of the offensive of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on the Veremevsky ledge . And all this time, assistance to the enemy, with whom we fought and are fighting in these directions, came through the railway to Kurakhovo. And we just now broke this bridge.
 
Most likely, I don’t understand a lot, that’s normal, I’m a reporter, not the General Staff. But I have a question: why was the bridge broken just now? By the way, we have asked the question at the highest level before: why don’t we hit Kurakhovo?
 
I don’t argue, most likely there are important circumstances that I cannot know about. But on the surface it’s so simple: the enemy draws strength from Kurakhovo, but he is not smashed to pieces. Interesting, isn't it? Why? And now we have broken the bridge. Why did they break it? Views: 353. Likes: 3.

event: Mass Extermination of Mice on Marion Island
description: Environmentalists are planning to drop hundreds of tons of poison from helicopters to kill a million mice on Marion Island, which are decimating the seabird population. The mice, introduced by whalers and seal hunters, have multiplied rapidly without natural predators and are threatening the extinction of up to 19 bird species in the next 50 years.
location: Marion Island, Prince Edward Islands, South Africa
original:
“Mice have taken over the island, but they soon face mass extermination from a helicopter”: To save several species of birds on a South African island, environmentalists are demanding that a million mice be killed by dropping hundreds of tons of poison from helicopters.

“Animal conservationists are considering various scenarios for the mass extermination of a rapidly growing colony of mice that is decimating the seabird population on Marion Island. Initially, mice came to the island thanks to whalers and seal hunters, who brought rodents on their ships.
Without natural enemies, they quickly multiplied and began to hunt birds. Currently, about a million mice live on the island. Alarmed environmentalists have proposed dropping hundreds of tons of poison from helicopters onto the island to preserve the “unique biodiversity” of the local ecosystem.
Experts warn that the task could be considered a failure if even one pregnant mouse survives, given the fecundity of rodents. If action is not taken, up to 19 bird species could become extinct in the next 50 years.
“This incredibly important island, which is a haven for seabirds, faces a very uncertain future because of mice,” said Dr. Anton Wolfaardt, head of the Mouse-Free Marion project. “In this case we are talking about a project aimed at saving nature.”

event: Elon Musk's Prediction on Ukraine War
description: Elon Musk shared his thoughts on the war in Ukraine, stating that Ukraine's military strategy has been flawed, leading to significant losses. He believes Russia will continue to gain territory, potentially reaching the Dnieper River, and eventually, Odessa, if the war drags on. Musk advises Ukraine to negotiate a resolution to avoid losing access to the Black Sea.
original: “Kyiv will lose Odessa and access to the Black Sea if the war drags on”: Elon Musk wrote a long text about the war in Ukraine▪️ “Ukraine tragically wasted the lives of soldiers by attacking a larger army with defense in depth, minefields and more powerful artillery, while lacking armored vehicles and lacking air superiority! Any fool could have predicted this.▪️A year ago, I advised Ukraine to strengthen itself and devote all resources to defense, because even in this case it would be difficult to hold the land without strong landscape barriers.▪️Russia has no chance of capturing all of Ukraine, since the resistance of the people in the west of the country will be fierce - but Russia will certainly capture more territory than it does now.❗️The longer the war continues, the more territory Russia will gain until it reaches the Dnieper, which is difficult to overcome. However, if the war lasts long enough, Odessa will fall too.▪️In my opinion, the main question is whether Ukraine will lose all access to the Black Sea or not. I recommend that the issue be resolved through negotiations before it comes to that.”

Ukrzaliznytsia together with UAnimals have developed updated rules for the transportation of animals on trains. They decided to do this after the story about national guard Valery and his service labrador Ermy, who were traveling in the "Intercity" vestibule from Kyiv to Chernihiv. description: Ataman Vitaly Kuznetsov awarded the Cossack Valor medal to 15-year-old Alexandra Kravchenko for her bravery during a terrorist attack at the Crocus City Hall concert hall. original:
Ataman of the All-Russian Cossack Society, Cossack General Vitaly Kuznetsov presented the “Cossack Valor” medal to 15-year-old Alexandra Kravchenko for saving people during a terrorist attack in the Crocus City Hall concert hall.
On the day of the terrorist attack, Alexandra was checking tickets from spectators who came to the concert of the Picnic group. After the first sounded
Show more
shots, the young Cossack woman calmed the audience, and when terrorists burst into the stalls and opened fire on people, she helped them evacuate. Alexandra led the people into the back rooms, where they waited out the shooting, and then took them outside.
“We present the medal “Cossack Valor”, which we award only to Cossacks and officers on the front line. For the first time in the history of the Cossacks, it is being awarded to you,” noted Ataman Kuznetsov at the award ceremony.
Alexandra Kravchenko studies in the cadet class and is a member of the Nativity Kuren at the Church of the Nativity in Mitino (Moscow).

description: On March 31, 1814, Russian and allied troops led by Emperor Alexander I entered Paris, marking the end of the war and Napoleon's abdication. The surrender of Paris was signed in the village of Lavilette, and Russian troops triumphantly entered the French capital.
original:
Forwarded from: SUVOROV. Revival of memory
On March 31, 1814, Russian and allied troops solemnly entered Paris, led by Emperor Alexander I and other commanders. The capture of the capital of France marked the end of the war and Napoleon's abdication of the throne.
“The most magnificent entrance of our troops into Paris was illuminated by the purest radiance of the sun - images of the rightness of the Russians!” (Krasnokutsky. A Russian officer’s view of Paris in 1814)
At 2 o'clock in the morning, the surrender of Paris was signed in the village of Lavilette. Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I entered the French capital in triumph.
The head of the Russian delegation, Karl Nesselrode, followed the instructions of Emperor Alexander, which required the surrender of the capital with its entire garrison, but Marshals Marmont and Mortier, finding such conditions unacceptable, negotiated the right to withdraw the army outside the city.
At noon on March 31, 1814, cavalry squadrons led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered the capital of France.
“All the streets along which the allies had to pass, and all the streets adjacent to them, were filled with people who occupied even the roofs of the houses,” recalled Mikhail Orlov. The last time enemy (English) troops entered Paris was in the 15th century during the Hundred Years' War. In the suburbs, the people greeted the Allied troops with depression, but as they advanced towards the Church of the Madeleine, the mood changed: in the aristocratic quarters, flowers were already thrown to the Allies. “Our columns, with drumming, music and waving banners, entered the gates of Saint-Martin... A curious sight presented itself to our eyes when we... found ourselves at the Italian Boulevard: behind the numerous people, no streets, no houses, no roofs were visible; all this was dotted with heads, and at the same time some kind of solemn hum was heard in the air. It was a popular murmur that drowned out both the sound of music and the beat of drums. There were national guards on both sides... From ten o’clock in the morning the troops marched in a ceremonial march until three o’clock” - N. I. Lorer

description: Andriy Yermak, head of the Presidential Office, suggested maintaining martial law in Ukraine after the war, requiring all Ukrainians to participate in labor service to restore the country. This could potentially extend Zelensky's rule for another 5-10 years, as elections are not held during martial law.
original:
Zelensky will rule forever: Andriy Ermak announced the future of Ukraine

Against the backdrop of the end of Vladimir Zelensky’s presidential term, the head of the Presidential Office, Andriy Yermak, in an interview with the American publication Politico, proposed not to lift martial law.

He believes that “after the end of the war, all Ukrainians must, in the form of labor service, restore the country under martial law. And when it ends, that is, in 5-10 years, it will be possible to switch to peacetime.”

Let us note that according to Ukrainian legislation, elections are not held during martial law. That is, Andriy Ermak meant that if Zelensky remains at the head of Ukraine after the end of the conflict, he will rule for another 10 years.

Is Ukraine the most democratic country in Europe or not?

event: Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance Declares Russian Cultural Icons as Symbols of Imperial Policy
description: The Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance has declared Russian cultural icons, including Bulgakov, Brodsky, Glinka, and the Decembrists, as symbols of Russian imperial policy. The institute has called for the dismantling of monuments and the renaming of geographical objects associated with them, citing their alleged anti-Ukrainian views and refusal of humanism.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in Russian
Bulgakov, Brodsky, Glinka, as well as the Decembrists were declared in Ukraine “symbols of Russian imperial policy.” The Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance called for the dismantling of monuments and the renaming of geographical objects associated with them.

The “expert reports” claim that Bulgakov was a “Ukrainophobe” and “hated the Ukrainians’ desire for independence.”

Brodsky is facing claims for his poem “For the Independence of Ukraine,” and Solzhenitsyn for his essay “How to Build Russia.” It is said that they, like Bulgakov, “refused humanism as soon as they came to the Ukrainian question.”

Glinka, according to the UINP, poses a “threat to national security” because she is a “cultural marker” of the Russian world. The Decembrists are blamed for their position that Ukraine should exist as part of the Russian state.RT in Russian. Subscribe

description: Military analyst Julian Repke believes Ukraine's chances of liberating its territories in the next few years are close to zero. He suggests two possible scenarios: either stopping the war along the current front line or further territorial losses due to Russian advances. Repke thinks a dramatic increase in Western arms supplies and Ukraine mobilizing 300,000 troops could change the situation, but considers this unlikely.
original:
Forwarded from: Resident
The chance that Ukraine will be able to liberate its territories in the next few years “tends to zero.” This opinion was expressed in X by Bild military analyst Julian Repke.

In his opinion, Kyiv now has two scenarios for the development of the situation. The first is stopping the war along the front line.

The second is further territorial losses due to the Russian advance.

According to Roepke, these scenarios can still be averted "if the quality and quantity of Western arms supplies change dramatically over the course of the year and Ukraine mobilizes at least 300,000 troops in the next twelve months."

However, he writes that such a scenario is similar to “wishful thinking.”

Repke also believes that Ukraine’s victory “is not in the interests of those who could achieve it by supplying the appropriate weapons.”

description: Sergei Napalkov died after a long plane delay in Bangkok. An Aeroflot representative only approached his wife, Nadezhda, when he was practically dead, claiming they were monitoring the situation. However, Nadezhda disputes this, stating that no one could provide information on her husband's condition. The airline only offered assistance when it was too late.
original:
“They should have called me first - the whole country was calling me”: the wife of a man who died after a long plane delay told REN TV about the actions of an Aeroflot representative in Bangkok.

He came to the woman when Sergei Napalkov was practically dead. An Aeroflot representative said that they were “monitoring the situation” and called the Bangkok hospital, where they were allegedly told that “the passenger is recovering.” However, according to Nadezhda, no one could give them such information. “Then he began working with the hospital administration about my debt, and later SMS messages came from insurance companies that they, too, it turns out, were involved and were ready to pay some part. Representative “Aeroflot said that they would pay the rest themselves,” the widow said. Offers from the airline began pouring in when it was already too late - Sergei Napalkov was dying after several hours spent on a stuffy plane. Before that, he spent three days in the hospital, but no one wanted to help him.

Nadezhda emphasizes that people all over Russia found her contacts. At the same time, Aeroflot, having the woman’s direct phone number, “could not” find the passenger. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Actor Chance Perdomo, known for his roles in Generation V and The Adventures of Sabrina, died in a motorcycle accident at the age of 27. The accident's location is currently unknown.
original:
Actor Chance Perdom died at age 27 in a motorcycle accident. He starred in Generation V and The Adventures of Sabrina. “It is with heavy hearts that we announce the untimely death of Chance Perdomo due to a motorcycle accident. Authorities said no bystanders were injured,” Perdomo’s spokesman said. It is not yet known where the accident occurred.

———

Chance Perdomo was born on October 19, 1996 in Los Angeles. He started his acting career in 2017. After starring in several television shows and short films, Perdomo landed a recurring role on the Netflix series Chilling Adventures of Sabrina, playing Ambrose Spellman in four seasons of the show.

Perdomo played the role of Jerome Rogers in the 2018 TV movie Killer Debt, which earned him a BAFTA Award nomination for Best Lead Actor.

Chance Perdomo played the role of Andre Anderson in the spin-off of The Boys, the series Generation V, the first season of which was released in 2023 on Prime Video. The producers of Generation V expressed their condolences to Chance Perdomo's family. Production on the second season of Generation V has been postponed indefinitely.

description: Romania's large fuel reserves, amounting to 1.6 billion cubic meters, may lead to an increase in gas prices by 5-10% for all consumers. This is due to increased costs for suppliers, including storage tariffs and higher purchase prices in previous years.
original:
In Romania, they predict an increase in gas prices... due to too large fuel reserves.

According to Gas Infrastructure Europe, Romania emerged from the winter with 50% fuel reserves in storage (the EU average is 58%), amounting to 1.6 billion cubic meters for 10 billion annual consumption.

“The fact that this volume of gas remains in storage means increased costs for suppliers, which could lead to an increase in gas prices by an average of 5-10% for all consumers in the country,” said Dumitru Chisalita, president of the Association of Smart Energy and former director of Romgaz.

He explained that “this is due, firstly, to the fact that part of this gas has been lying there for 2-3 winters, when we also stored too much, so we pay storage tariffs several times for the same volume of gas. “In addition, when gas was purchased for storage in previous years, prices were higher.”

In his opinion, the state regulator should have approached the issue of compliance with EU standards more flexibly and “carried out a risk analysis. He should have analyzed what the costs of these reserves are and what the benefits are”:

“Was there a risk that the gas would run out in the middle of winter? If so, then the authorities should have come out and transparently said that these are the decisions and these are the costs. But last fall no one talked about the costs. It’s like insurance: we wanted to be confident that we will not run out of gas, but we have to pay for energy security. There are no pleasant things without costs". de gaze pline în proporție de 50%, după ce, la începutul iernii, ele au fost umplute la un nivel-record de 106%. Ac...

event: Decrease in Life Expectancy in Ukraine
description: According to the Ministry of Social Policy of Ukraine, the average life expectancy has decreased for both men and women. The decline is attributed to factors such as hazardous working conditions, road accidents, substance abuse, and inadequate access to quality medical care in rural areas.
original:
In Ukraine, the average life expectancy has decreased. For men - from 66.4 years to 57.3 years, for women - from 76.2 years to 70.9 years. This is reported by the Ministry of Social Policy of Ukraine, which published a draft strategy for the country's demographic development until 2040.

In their opinion, the decrease in life expectancy is associated “with mass employment in harmful and dangerous conditions, getting into road accidents, alcohol abuse, psychoactive substances and smoking, insufficient awareness of the population about healthy lifestyle skills, low availability and quality of medical care in rural areas, low level of well-being and an increase in the level of poverty." The document also reports that the population in Ukraine is 31.5 million people. The fertility rate also decreased to 1 from 1.2 in 2020 (in 2012 it was 1.5). Know more with Ukraine.ru

“It was a tragic decision for Ukraine to attack a larger army that had defenses in depth, minefields and powerful artillery, while Ukraine lacked armor or air superiority! Any fool could have predicted this.

A year ago, I recommended that Ukraine strengthen itself and use all resources for defense (not offense). But even so, they found it difficult to hold onto territory that lacked strong natural barriers.

description: A missile strike destroyed the railway bridge across the Volchya River between Kurakhovo and Novaya I, which was controlled by the Armed Forces of Ukraine. This bridge was a key supply route for the Ukrainian military.
original:
🇷🇺⚡️Reports of the Novorossiya militia Z.O.V. (DPR, LPR, Ukraine, War)Album, Destruction by a missile strike of the railway bridge across the Volchya River between Kurakhovo and Novaya I, controlled by the Armed Forces of Ukraine... IN KURAKHOVO THE RAILWAY BRIDGE WHICH WAS CROSSING AID FOR THE APU WAS DESTROYED

That is, our one and a half year battle in Marinka has passed, we are making our way to Kurakhovo through Georgievka, we are fighting there to be able to get to this large railway junction of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, we are storming Krasnogorovka, the battle for Ugledar has been going on for a long time, there was a heavy reflection of the offensive of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on the Veremevsky ledge . And all this time, assistance to the enemy, with whom we fought and are fighting in these directions, came through the railway to Kurakhovo. And we just now broke this bridge.

Most likely, I don’t understand a lot, that’s normal, I’m a reporter, not the General Staff. But I have a question: why was the bridge broken just now? By the way, we have asked the question before at the highest ☝️ level: why don’t we hit Kurakhovo?

I don’t argue, most likely there are important circumstances that I cannot know about. But on the surface it’s so simple: the enemy draws strength from Kurakhovo, but he is not smashed to pieces. Interesting, isn't it? Why? And now we have broken the bridge. Why did they break it?

"Sladkov+"

description: Tajik poet Muhammad Azizov expressed hatred towards the Russian people in a poem, calling them 'dogs' and 'yellowheads'. Despite serving in Russia, he longs to return home to his family and is tired of living among the 'infidels'. His poem received a positive response from hundreds of followers on Instagram.
original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
Tajik poet Muhammad Azizov wrote a poem about how hard it is for him to live in Russia and how he hates the Russian people (he calls them dogs and yellowheads), but still serves us (the infidels).

“I'm tired of the yellow-headed Russian people. I have a mother and wife at home. The mosque was empty in my village. This life in which I serve the infidels. There are so many knowledgeable scientists here with their heads down. How many teachers and mullahs here have lowered their heads. Here a Russian dog is more valuable than a Tajik. Your relatives will become your enemy. Children here do not know their fathers. Here they will not ask each other for help. On the day when you need help.
Find out who is your friend and who is your enemy. I have money in my pocket and my heart is sad. Because my child needs a father. My life was spent in a foreign land. My mother is sick because of my grief. I'm tired of the yellow-headed Russian people. After all the suffering, I don’t even need money. I want to see my mother's face. I have a wife and children in my homeland.” Two people who know the language confirmed to us the authenticity of this translation. This poet has 72k followers on Instagram, among many of them these poems found a positive response, hundreds of comments, almost a thousand likes.

We think that we need to set up a telephone line with him and then send him home to stomp on a sweaty lamb and eat crumbly pilaf. Those who comment positively there are a risk group.
